please tag me in any photos of your projects that you post online @heathernobledesigns ©2021 heather noble designs some tips i ve gathered along the way… 1 stitch markers are your friend i especially recommend using them for angle stitches keep them in until you complete the row above the angle so you know where the stitches surrounding the angle go as well as the angle stitch itself wow i used the word angle a lot there 2 yarn weight you can technically use any yarn for mosaic crochet when i first started designing i was mostly creating baby blankets all my calculations were for a weight 3 dk yarn so it wouldn t be too heavy for a small child since then i ve branched out into other categories but my math calculations were already tried and true so i continue to use that for my basic calculations use yarn that you love 3 hook size i typically use a smaller hook size than what the yarn label recommends so that my stitches don t have gaps between them my go-to for most projects is a g-4mm hook with weight 4 yarn aran/worsted and an f-3 75mm hook with weight 3 yarn dk everyone s gauge and gauge vary so use what works for you 4 i use a larger hook for my foundation chain the beginning row is tighter because it is made entirely of single_crochet stitches so just go up a hook size to solve this problem 5 to anchor or not to anchor double_crochet stitches is a personal preference there is no right or wrong answer i don t recommend anchoring angle stitches unless it is specifically noted in a design 6 have you tried the knit companion app yet this has been a game changer for me and saved a lot of paper and ink knit companion video ©2021 heather noble designs mosaic crochet basics all work is done on the front side of the work do not turn alternate colors every row all single_crochet stitches are worked into the back loops of same row all double_crochet stitches are worked into the corresponding front loop 2 row below ©2021 heather noble designs getting started first 2 row row 1 foundation row color b chain 38 single_crochet in 2nd chain from the hook and in each chain across 37 *optional make an i-cord foundation chain of 37 chain 1 single_crochet under both loops of each i-cord st across 37 i-cord tutorial row 2 color a starting in row 2 each row will begin and end with a border stitch bs *see stitch key* bs scblo 35 bs ©2021 heather noble
